Articles.Content: Tried launching a rocket in a brand new career save when i realised theres no crew slots despite using a crew pod
Which pod? What mods do you have installed? What happens if you try a sandbox save rather than career?

KV-1 Onion  and it happens on anything that can have crew modded or stock  because of it im only able to use probes

Edited January 28, 2023 by SayWhat
Can you give us a screen shot of the craft in question?
I built this in my copy, and I have crew slots.  My guess is it is one of your mods, but we will need a mod list in order to help further.
figured it out that its tweakscale but now the problem is its a depedency for some of the mods i would want to keep

On 2/1/2023 at 10:15 PM, SayWhat said:

figured it out that its tweakscale but now the problem is its a depedency for some of the mods i would want to keep

Could you be missing one of tweakscale's dependencies?  I ran into different problems, but I was missing one on my most recent build & it messed my game up pretty bad till I found the missing one.
tweakscale has all depedencies the only thing i can think of is confilicting configs for tweakscale

On 1/27/2023 at 5:57 PM, SayWhat said:

Tried launching a rocket in a brand new career save when i realised theres no crew slots despite using a crew pod

Hi! Only found this today, sorry for being late.

If you are scaling parts down, the Crew Capacity is reduced accordingly - and eventually you will get a part too small for holding a crew.

Ideally, scaling up would add crew - but KSP since 1.8 or 1.9 shut this door definitively for TweakScale. Squad implemented a cap on it and any attempt to scale crew up is squashed on launch.

Sorry.
i did not try scaling the only capsules that work are the ones that tweakscale cant change

I'm seeing a similar problem where it only shows 1 seat available but there are 3. I have 3  Mk1 capsules. The center one (root part) does show up but the 2 on the sides, don't. Then I removed and replaced the 2 capsules on the sides (in symmetry) and that fixed it.
